description: This Dart source file defines the TransactionProvider class, which manages fetching, creating, updating, and deleting financial transaction data from a backend API. It acts as a state management component within a Flutter application, handling network requests via a NetworkHelper utility and maintaining a list of TransactionModel instances. The class also provides functions to compute category totals based on current transactions.

classes.name: TransactionProvider
classes.description: A provider class for managing transaction data and network operations related to transactions in a Flutter app.

methods.name: clearError
methods.description: Clears the current error message and notifies listeners.

methods.name: fetchTransactions
methods.description: Fetches the list of transactions from the server using an authentication token; updates internal list and error state accordingly.

methods.name: addTransaction
methods.description: Adds a new transaction via a POST request; refreshes the transaction list upon success.

methods.name: updateTransaction
methods.description: Updates an existing transaction via a PUT request; refreshes the list upon success.

methods.name: deleteTransaction
methods.description: Deletes a transaction by its ID via a DELETE request; refreshes the list upon success.

methods.name: categoryTotals
methods.description: Calculates and returns the total amount per category based on current transactions.
